ai.summary: Glen Banvie Trail is a challenging 32.1 km hike in the UK, intended for experienced hikers. This guide provides a concise overview of terrain, safety, gear, best seasons, and SEO metadata for planning.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect varied terrain including rough tracks, rocky sections, forest paths, moorland, and possible boggy ground. Significant elevation gain and several exposed sections; navigation skills are recommended. Weather in the UK can change quickly, so be prepared for wet conditions and reduced daylight, especially outside summer.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for long hours and changeable conditions. Tell someone your route and expected finish time. Carry a map and compass (or a GPS with offline maps) and know how to use them. Stay on the route, monitor fatigue and hydration, and have contingencies for bad weather. In upland or exposed sections, be prepared for sudden weather changes and turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (base layer, insulating layer, waterproof outer layer)
Water and high-energy snacks (2 L+ water depending on conditions)
Map and compass; GPS or offline maps as backup
ai.best_seasons: May to September is generally the best window for visibility and moderate weather in the UK; shoulder months (April, October) can be good with careful preparation, while winter hiking is more demanding and less predictable.
